intro: Epilobium khasianum, commonly known as the Khasi willow, is a herbaceous plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Epilobium khasianum is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
